alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Richmond; Western Essex; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:40PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Richmond, northwestern Westmoreland, northeastern Caroline and Essex Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 540 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Massaponax to Port Royal to Leedstown. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colonial Beach, Tappahannock, Montross, Champlain, Port Royal, Newland, Loretto, Leedstown, Fort A.p. Hill, Hustle, Potomac Beach, Guinea, Corbin, Elevon, Supply, Stratford Hall, Mount Landing, Dunbrooke, Rappahannock Academy and Lerty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
